meanings.definition: To eat more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outeat her brother during dinner.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outeat his friends when they go out for meals.
meanings.sent3: During the eating contest, she managed to outeat everyone with ease.
meanings.sent4: His appetite was so big that he could outeat a bear.
meanings.sent5: The competitive eater was able to outeat all his opponents and win the championship.

meanings.definition: To consume more food than is necessary or healthy.
meanings.sent1: It's not good to outeat to the point of feeling sick.
meanings.sent2: She tends to outeat when she's stressed out.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he could outeat a sumo wrestler with his appetite.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were bigger than her stomach, leading her to outeat at the buffet.
meanings.sent5: The holiday feast was so tempting that it was hard not to outeat.
